content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-201-02-A
|Item_parent=Organ transplants: epidemiological and immunological aspects; principles of treatment and monitoring; complications and prognosis; ethical and legal aspects. Organ procurement and legislation
|Item_parent_short=Organ transplants: epidemiological and immunological aspects; principles of treatment and monitoring; complications and prognosis; ethical and legal aspects. Organ procurement and legislation
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the definition of transplanted tissues and organs
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Dany Anglicheau
|Order=2}}

The different organs transplanted are :

*Rein
*Liver
*Heart
*Pancreas
*Lungs
*Intestines


Cell and tissue transplants can involve :

*Haematopoietic stem cells
*Cornea
*Amniotic membranes
*bones, tendons, ligaments, menisci
*Skin
*Heart valves, arteries and veins

question.title: What types of tissues and organs can be transplanted?

option_a.title: Only organs like kidneys and livers can be transplanted
option_a.description: This option is partially correct, but not entirely accurate

option_b.title: All of the above (rein, liver, heart, pancreas, lungs, intestines, hematopoietic stem cells, cornea, amniotic membranes, bones, tendons, ligaments, menisci, skin, heart valves, arteries, and veins)
option_b.description: This option includes all the correct answer choices

option_c.title: Only tissues like skin and cornea can be transplanted
option_c.description: This option is partially correct, but not entirely accurate

option_d.title: Only organs like kidneys and livers can be transplanted in an adult
option_d.description: This option is partially correct, but not entirely accurate
